title: Tutorial document_create_from_html()
text: rspacer package example file. RStudio, go File > New File > R Markdown. moment (28-10-2024) yet option create Quarto files template, chose provide file R Markdown template. left, click Template. Choose rspacer Template example. Save file Quarto file (.qmd). Render file html report. Alternatively, can create new Quarto document. Include headers Rspace Template previously created Step 3, make sure headers two hashtags (h2 headers, ##). can write code, use h3 h4 headers (three four hashtags), long h2 headers identical structured document template.

what: Specify the template and folder to upload to
title: Tutorial document_create_from_html()
text: can ‘walk’ folders find folder notebook want upload Structured Document, using folder_tree() function rspacer. want replace file, also define existing file id. complicated document Basic Document, specify identifier Template well. Folder identifiers start FL. Notebook identifiers start NB. Structured document identifiers start SD.
code: folder_tree() ## # A tibble: 10 × 9 ##        id globalId name                   created         lastModified parentFolderId type  `_links` owner        ##     <int> <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>           <chr>                 <int> <chr> <list>   <list>       ##  1 356307 SD356307 Gerhard Burger         2024-01-17T14:… 2024-01-17T…           7813 DOCU… <list>   <named list> ##  2 260004 FL260004 LACDR RDM              2023-11-06T10:… 2023-11-06T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> ##  3 242175 FL242175 GABi001_EMP_regulation 2023-05-30T10:… 2023-06-14T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> ##  4 242400 FL242400 Ontologies             2023-06-01T07:… 2023-06-01T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> ##  5 242398 FL242398 Api Inbox              2023-06-01T07:… 2023-06-01T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> ##  6 242182 FL242182 Publications           2023-05-30T11:… 2023-05-30T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> ##  7  21961 FL21961  DDS2 Data management   2023-03-16T09:… 2023-03-16T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> ##  8   7833 FL7833   Templates              2022-12-22T12:… 2022-12-22T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> ##  9   7819 GF7819   Gallery                2022-12-22T12:… 2022-12-22T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> ## 10   7814 FL7814   Shared                 2022-12-22T12:… 2022-12-22T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   <named list> #folder_tree("") # Specify folder ID in brackets to keep walking.  folder_id <- "" # Specify folder ID for upload template_id <- "" # SD identifier of the template field_nr_for_code <- 0 # Specify the field in which the code file needs to be attached. existing_file_id <- "" # Optional, used if one wants to replace a file. Leave empty string if no file needs to be created.  tags <- c("") # You can add multiple tags in a vector. For example a grant number, or "finished" or "in progress" or "failed".

previous_headings: Specify the template and folder to upload to
title: Tutorial document_create_from_html()
text: Create RSpace document using code chunk . creates document Template_example.html rendered file, places .qmd name fourth field structured document. folder_id specified, function document_create_from_html() creates document ‘API Inbox’. Optionally, can add tags replace entire document. Make sure template_id identifier template previously made Rspace. upload document attachment API inbox, code chunk sufficient: function document_create_from_html parameters, example upload document specified notebook folder. want upload code file well, added number field attachment. Use existing_file_id file needs replaced instead created.
code: document_create_from_html(     path = file_name,     template_id = "SD377682" ) ## Error in curl::curl_parse_url(url, baseurl = base_url, decode = FALSE): Failed to parse URL: Bad scheme if(existing_file_id == ""){   document_create_from_html(     path = file_name,     template_id = template_id,     folder_id = folder_id,     tags = tags,     attachment = list(field = field_nr_for_code, path = matching_code_file)   ) } else {   document_create_from_html(     path = file_name,     template_id = template_id,     folder_id = folder_id,     tags = tags,     attachment = list(field = field_nr_for_code, path = matching_code_file),     existing_file_id  = existing_file_id   ) } ## Error in curl::curl_parse_url(url, baseurl = base_url, decode = FALSE): Failed to parse URL: Malformed input to a URL function

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: use rspacer needs know two things: API URL RSpace instance (typically URL RSpace instance followed api/v1, e.g. https://leiden.researchspace.com/api/v1) API key, authentication token can use instead username password. create API key go ‘Manage API Key’ section RSpace profile page (MyRSpace -> Profile). keep API key private. can regenerate API key time, invalidate old key. can use set_api_url() set_api_key() function make available rspacer current session. make information persistent can store environment variables. easy way usethis::edit_r_environ(); file opens, add following lines (insert URL key): saving file restarting R, now able run

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: Now can use rspacer interact RSpace Workspace. example, folder_tree() show content Workspace tibble: can also specify id Unique ID (globalId) show contents specific folder:
code: folder_tree() #> # A tibble: 10 × 9 #>        id globalId name              created lastModified parentFolderId type  `_links` #>     <int> <chr>    <chr>             <chr>   <chr>                 <int> <chr> <list>   #>  1 356307 SD356307 Gerhard Burger    2024-0… 2024-01-17T…           7813 DOCU… <list>   #>  2 260004 FL260004 LACDR RDM         2023-1… 2023-11-06T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #>  3 242175 FL242175 GABi001_EMP_regu… 2023-0… 2023-06-14T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #>  4 242400 FL242400 Ontologies        2023-0… 2023-06-01T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #>  5 242398 FL242398 Api Inbox         2023-0… 2023-06-01T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #>  6 242182 FL242182 Publications      2023-0… 2023-05-30T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #>  7  21961 FL21961  DDS2 Data manage… 2023-0… 2023-03-16T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #>  8   7833 FL7833   Templates         2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #>  9   7819 GF7819   Gallery           2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #> 10   7814 FL7814   Shared            2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7813 FOLD… <list>   #> # ℹ 1 more variable: owner <list> folder_tree(7819) #> # A tibble: 8 × 9 #>      id globalId name   created lastModified parentFolderId type  `_links` owner        #>   <int> <chr>    <chr>  <chr>   <chr>                 <int> <chr> <list>   <list>       #> 1  7828 GF7828   Snipp… 2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7819 FOLD… <list>   <named list> #> 2  7827 GF7827   PdfDo… 2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7819 FOLD… <list>   <named list> #> 3  7826 GF7826   Misce… 2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7819 FOLD… <list>   <named list> #> 4  7825 GF7825   Docum… 2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7819 FOLD… <list>   <named list> #> 5  7824 GF7824   Chemi… 2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7819 FOLD… <list>   <named list> #> 6  7823 GF7823   Videos 2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7819 FOLD… <list>   <named list> #> 7  7822 GF7822   Audios 2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7819 FOLD… <list>   <named list> #> 8  7820 GF7820   Images 2022-1… 2022-12-22T…           7819 FOLD… <list>   <named list>

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: can retrieve documents using result json converted R list, get field information use
code:
res <- document_retrieve("SD356307") summary(res) #> Length Class Mode #> id 1 -none- numeric #> globalId 1 -none- character #> name 1 -none- character #> created 1 -none- character #> lastModified 1 -none- character #> parentFolderId 1 -none- numeric #> signed 1 -none- logical #> tags 0 -none- NULL #> tagMetaData 0 -none- NULL #> form 10 -none- list #> owner 10 -none- list #> fields 8 -none- list #> _links 1 -none- list library(tidyverse) tibble(fields = res$fields) |> unnest_wider(fields) |> select(name, type, content) #> # A tibble: 8 × 3 #> name type content #> #> 1 Template Used string "LACDR-ISA - Contact v0.2.0" #> 2 Name string "Gerhard A. Burger" #> 3 Email string "g.a.burger@lacdr.leidenuniv.nl" #> 4 Phone string "" #> 5 ORCID string "0000-0003-1062-5576" #> 6 Address text "

7 Affiliation string "Leiden University" #> 8 Roles text ""

title: Introduction to rspacer
text: Creating documents currently possible using (unexported) low level rspacer:::document_post() function. example, following code create Basic Document ‘ApiInbox’ folder document_create_from_html() wrapper around previous document_post function creates body HTML file (e.g. generated quarto) splitting html h2 tag. Note Template used MUST number fields sections HTML file. Detailed descriptions can found Tutorial document_create_from_html. WORK PROGRESS info see https://community.researchspace.com/public/apiDocs [POST /documents].
code: # construct body body_r <- list(   name = "rspacer_create_doc",   tags = "API",   fields = list(     list(content = "Creating a document using rspacer is not (yet) easy")   ) ) res <- rspacer:::document_post(body_r) #> Document created: <https://leiden.researchspace.com/globalId/SD376167> file_name <- here("vignettes/articles/Template_example.html") matching_code_file <- str_replace(file_name, ".html$", ".qmd") document_create_from_html(     path = file_name,     template_id = "SD377682" ) #> Document created: <https://leiden.researchspace.com/globalId/SD389614>

what: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
text: Append html document (e.g., generated quarto) RSpace structured document. function retrieves current document, adds text fields specified h2 html headers.

title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
code: document_append_from_html(   path,   existing_document_id,   tags = NULL,   attachment = NULL,   allow_missing_fields = FALSE,   api_key = get_api_key() )

title: Add html content to an existing RSpace document — document_append_from_html
text: path html document uploaded existing_document_id document identifier current RSpace document. tags vector tags apply document attachment attachment attach one fields, e.g., list(field = 7, path = "file.txt") allow_missing_fields Specify mismatch fields allowed. FALSE, html fields appended RSpace document fields missing. TRUE, fields name template appended. api_key RSpace API key

title: Upload a tabular document to RSpace — document_create_from_excel
code: document_create_from_excel(   path,   file_type = NULL,   document_name = NULL,   template_id = NULL,   folder_id = NULL,   tags = NULL,   attachment = NULL,   api_key = get_api_key(),   existing_document_id = NULL )

title: Upload a tabular document to RSpace — document_create_from_excel
text: path tabular file upload. Can XLSX, CSV TSV file_type optional character string specify file type. guessed file name specified. document_name specify name RSpace entry. specified, value Title, Name, title, name one fields Excel document. exist, file name. template_id document id RSpace template used folder_id folder_id document created (can notebook) tags vector tags apply document attachment attachment attach one fields, e.g., list(field = 7, path = "file.txt") api_key RSpace API key existing_document_id want replace document new one, specify current identifier .

Overwritten template existing_document_id one specified. folder_id folder_id document created (can notebook) tags vector tags apply document attachment attachment attach one fields, e.g., list(field = 7, path = "file.txt") existing_document_id want replace document new one, specify current identifier . api_key RSpace API key

what: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
title: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
text: Sets RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable provided RSpace API key. create API key go 'Manage API Key' section profile page (MyRSpace -> Profile).

title: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
text: rspace_api_key RSpace API key

title: Set the RSPACE_API_KEY environment variable — set_api_key
text: set environment variable current session, set permanently, add RSPACE_API_KEY=<your_api_key_here> .Renviron file, example, using usethis::edit_r_environ().

what: Set the RSPACE_API_URL environment variable — set_api_url

title: Set the RSPACE_API_URL environment variable — set_api_url
